content:
Hello, I'm trying to prove that an injective homomorphism f induces an isomorphism, to prove the left inverse, I've reached the goal
f (classical.some _) = f x where _ : f x ∈ set.range f.

The type of the hole is equivalent to ∃ y, f y = f x so I think that classical.some _ should give some y where f y = f x. Does anyone have any advice on how I can work with the classical.someto get out the value it returns ?
classical.some_spec should be the proof you're looking for.
But if you're working in tactic mode, then the choose tactic should enable you to avoid all this pain.
Sorry I meant classical.some, I'll fix the question. Thanks a lot!
